author: Anonymous Scale
title: v and c in solved?
question: what do the v and c represent in the solved? function. i understand that we are looking for the true values in the board but what are we adding to the value?
instructor_answer:
The combination function we provide to foldr takes in two arguments: The first element of the list and the result of the natural recursion.
foldr acts on bd, which is a list of pegs.
v represents a peg in our board (which is a Boolean, so either true or false), and c represents the result of our natural recursion which is a Natural, because we want our foldr to produce a Natural. We are adding 1 to the natural recursion everytime we find that v is true, because we're counting up the number of trues in the entire bd.
I would recommend taking a look at function definition for foldr, and taking the helper function Paul created and putting it into the body of your foldr, it'll help with visualizing what's going on 😊
